creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
We are load testing a new web site. Within an hour of the 
simulated user load being applied, the tomcat process hangs
and reports 'out of memory error'. The process is still alive, 
but we are unable to communicate over port 8007. 
Tomcat web server is also running port 8080, but we are unable 
to get a response from this either. The only
way to resolve is to kill the tomcat process and restart tomcat.

Has anyone come across this problem and if so how was it resolved.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Not enough data to reproduce, all tests show tomcat working ok wrt memory
( unless you create sessions continuously - for example by load testing 
a jsp where a session is created by default unless disabled). You can use 
the config to set a limit on sessions if that's the problem

Make sure you set the -Xmx flag to an appropriate value of your application.
If you are running the NIO connector, known to have a mem leak in 6.0.10, just
get the code from subversion.
